subject: Nutrition
title: Why Water Matters for Performance
description: A quick win: understand Why Water Matters for Performance.

hook.text: Losing just 2% of body weight in sweat drops performance by 10 to 20%. Water is fuel.

buildup.text: Water carries nutrients to muscles, removes waste, regulates temperature, and lubricates joints.

discovery.text: Dehydrated muscles generate less force and fatigue faster because chemical reactions slow without water.

twist.text: Thirst arrives after 1 to 2% dehydration. By the time you feel it, performance is already declining.

climax.text: Hydration is the easiest performance variable to controlâ€”yet athletes neglect it most often.

punchline.text: Water is the cheapest legal performance enhancer.

quiz.question: At what dehydration level does performance drop significantly?
